marketNews.title: BBCA 10M24: Net Profit +15% YoY, Loan Growth Continues to Strengthen
marketNews.content:
Bank Central Asia (BBCA) recorded a net profit (bank only) of 5.9 trillion rupiah (+34% MoM, +19% YoY) in October 2024. This result brings the net profit (bank only) over 10M24 to grow to 46.2 trillion rupiah (+15% YoY). This performance was driven by: 1) continued strengthening of loan growth; 2) renewed increase in Net Interest Margin (NIM); and 3) reversal of provision expenses.

- Loan Growth Continues to Strengthen

BBCA's bank-only loans grew +14.2% YoY during 10M24, exceeding management's consolidated FY24 guidance in the range of 10-12%. This increase is higher compared to the growth of third-party funds (DPK) which was only +2.7% YoY, causing the Loan-to-Deposit Ratio (LDR) to increase to the 78% level. However, the company's LDR is still lower compared to other big banks (bank only). For comparison, as of September 2024, the LDR for BMRI reached 93.7%, BBRI 89.6%, and BBNI 95.3%.

- NIM Increases Again

BBCA managed to record a NIM of 5.93% in October 2024 (+18 bps MoM, +39 bps YoY), marking the second highest monthly level since at least 2022. This result brought the NIM over 10M24 up to the 5.7% level (+21 bps YoY), in line with management's consolidated FY24 guidance in the range of 5.7-5.8%. This NIM increase was driven by the shift in asset mix composition towards higher yield assets, one of which came from placements in Bank Indonesia into government bonds and loans.

- Reversal of Provision Expenses

BBCA recorded a reversal of provision expenses of 341 billion rupiah in October 2024 (vs. September 2024: provision expense of 541 billion rupiah). This caused the credit cost during 10M24 to improve to the 0.22% level, better than management's consolidated FY24 guidance in the range of 0.3-0.4%.

- Dividend Income from Subsidiaries

The increase in BBCA's net profit was also driven by dividend income from subsidiaries amounting to 1.1 trillion rupiah in October 2024, bringing the total dividends received during 10M24 to 2.3 trillion rupiah. Although dividends from subsidiaries are included in Non-Interest Income in the bank-only financial statements, it should be noted that this income will be eliminated in the consolidated financial statements.

Key Takeaway

We assess the bank-only performance of BBCA in October 2024 as positive, especially from the company's success in maintaining loan growth with a good NIM. Although loans are growing in line with management guidance, BBCA's liquidity is still considered ample compared to other big banks, so BBCA has room to maintain the cost of funds and grow loans. We also see a positive trend in BBCA's performance in maintaining credit costs, which indicates that asset quality is well maintained.

*This article was released earlier as Stockbit Commentary.

marketNews.title: BBTN Enters Negotiation Stage for Bank Acquisition
marketNews.content: Bank Tabungan Negara (BBTN) stated in a clarification to the IDX that the company is in negotiations and preparing a conditional sale and purchase agreement to acquire a bank. However, BBTN has not disclosed the details of the bank to be acquired. Previously, Kontan reported in October 2024 that BBTN had agreed on an acquisition value of 1.7 trillion rupiah with the prospective sharia bank to be acquired to become the shell for the spin-off of the company's sharia business unit (UUS), BTN Syariah. This figure is higher than Kontan's report in early August 2024 at the level of 1.3 trillion rupiah.

marketNews.title: Economic Consensus Expects Bank Indonesia to Maintain BI Rate at 6% in Board of Governors Meeting on Wednesday (20/11)
marketNews.content: The economic consensus expects Bank Indonesia to maintain the BI Rate at the 6% level in the Board of Governors Meeting on Wednesday (20/11), according to a survey conducted by Reuters. Economic consensus also expects the BI Rate to only be cut by -25 bps to the 5.75% level in December 2024, 25 bps less than expectations in the previous survey. The expectation of a smaller BI Rate cut is driven by the weakening rupiah exchange rate against the US dollar in line with sentiment following Donald Trump's victory in the US presidential election.

marketNews.title: Employers' Associations Request Government to Postpone VAT Hike to 12% Starting Early 2025
marketNews.content: Kontan reported that the Indonesian Employers' Association (Apindo), the Indonesian Textile Association (API), and the Indonesian Retail and Shopping Center Tenants Association (Hipindo) requested the government to postpone the Value Added Tax (VAT) increase to 12% planned to start in early 2025. Business actors assess that public purchasing power is currently unstable, so the VAT increase plan will actually suppress demand and harm the industry. Based on Kompas records, President Prabowo Subianto once promised in January 2024 not to increase tax rates if elected in the 2024 election.

marketNews.title: House Legislation Body Proposes Tax Amnesty Bill as Priority National Legislation Program in 2025
marketNews.content: The House Legislation Body has proposed the tax amnesty bill (RUU) as one of the priority national legislation programs in 2025. If realized, this will be the 3rd tax amnesty program in the last decade after 2016-2017 and 2022.

marketNews.title: Government Provides 0% Import Duty and State-borne Luxury Goods Sales Tax (PPnBM DTP) Incentives for Imported Electric Cars
marketNews.content: The Government through Investment and Downstreaming Minister/BKPM Regulation No. 1/2024 grants 0% import duty and state-borne luxury goods sales tax (PPnBM DTP) incentives for imported electric cars, both completely built up (CBU) and completely knock down (CKD) forms with a domestic component level ranging from 20-40%. Based on this regulation valid until December 31, 2025, the PPnBM DTP incentive for imported cars is only given to business actors who import from countries that have international agreements with Indonesia. Furthermore, these incentives will also be given to business actors who will build electric car factories in Indonesia, producers who already have conventional car factories and will switch to electric cars, as well as companies that have already invested in electric car manufacturing facilities.

marketNews.title: SKK Migas Notes Upstream Oil and Gas Investment Realization in 10M24 Only Reached 58.2% of 2024 Target
marketNews.content: SKK Migas recorded that upstream oil and gas investment realization during 10M24 only reached 10.3 billion US dollars (+1% YoY), meeting only 58.2% of the 2024 target of 17.7 billion US dollars. The Head of SKK Migas, Djoko Siswanto, mentioned that his party projects upstream oil and gas investment realization throughout 2024 can reach 16 billion US dollars, indicating an increase of +16.6% YoY. Djoko stated that the weak realization of upstream oil and gas investment was caused by the obstruction of several jobs due to domestic component level (TKDN) issues. This obstacle also disrupted the realization of oil and gas lifting during 10M24, which only reached 1.56 million BOEPD or only 94% of the 2024 APBN target of 1.66 million BOEPD.

marketNews.title: National Coal Production Reaches 711.37 Million Tons as of November 15, 2024, Exceeding 2024 Government Target
marketNews.content: National coal production has reached 711.37 million tons as of November 15, 2024, already exceeding the government's 2024 target of 710 million tons. Nevertheless, this realization is still far from the production target in the 2024 work plan and budget (RKAB) of 922.14 million tons. According to the Acting Executive Director of the Indonesian Coal Mining Association (APBI), Gita Mahyarani, his party predicts that national coal production throughout 2024 will range around 800 million tons (vs. 2023 realization: 775 million tons).

marketNews.title: Apple Increases Investment Offer Nearly 10x to Negotiate Lifting of iPhone 16 Sales Ban in Indonesia
marketNews.content: Bloomberg reported that Apple Inc. (Nasdaq: AAPL) has increased its offer to invest in Indonesia nearly 10 times its previous offer to persuade the government to lift the ban on sales of the iPhone 16 series. Bloomberg sources mentioned that Apple now plans to invest nearly 100 million US dollars in Indonesia over the next 2 years, up from the previous report of 10 million US dollars. The government had banned the sale of the iPhone 16 series in Indonesia because the product had not yet obtained a domestic component level (TKDN) certificate. The government stated that the TKDN certificate would only be issued after Apple fulfilled an investment commitment of 1.7 trillion rupiah, of which the company had only fulfilled 1.5 trillion rupiah.

tickerNews.title: TPIA Opens Opportunity to Serve Third-Party Raw Material Transportation via Subsidiary CDI
tickerNews.content: $TPIA: Chandra Asri Pacific Director, Edi Riva'i, [said](https://epaper.kontan.co.id/mobile/harian/2024/11/19) that the company is opening the opportunity to serve raw material transportation services to third parties through its subsidiary, PT Chandra Daya Investasi (CDI). [Previously](https://snips.stockbit.com/snips-terbaru/adro-analisis-skenario-spinoff-aadi#:~:text=Chandra%20Asri%20Pacific,Marina%20Indah%20Maritim.), CDI acquired 4 units of oil or chemical tanker vessels and natural gas tanker vessels, which are intended for the company's operational efficiency. Going forward, CDI targets the addition of 15 new vessels throughout 2025.

tickerNews.title: Controlling Shareholder of SPMA Buys Significant Stake from Another Controller, While Another Controller Increases Ownership
tickerNews.content: $SPMA: Suparma controller, [Cathay Utima Investment Pte. Ltd](https://www.idx.co.id/StaticData/NewsAndAnnouncement/ANNOUNCEMENTSTOCK/From_EREP/202411/6d243c3351_00cde59d73.pdf)., bought 674 million SPMA shares from another SPMA controller, [PT Wahana Bumi Indonesia](https://www.idx.co.id/StaticData/NewsAndAnnouncement/ANNOUNCEMENTSTOCK/From_EREP/202411/b8e0b843df_8da5468003.pdf), at a price of 304 rupiah per share on November 13, 2024. The total transaction value reached ~205 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Cathay Utima Investment Pte. Ltd.'s ownership in SPMA increased from 18.01% to 39.38%, while PT Wahana Bumi Indonesia's ownership decreased from 25% to 3.63%. In addition, SPMA's controller and main commissioner, [Welly](https://www.idx.co.id/StaticData/NewsAndAnnouncement/ANNOUNCEMENTSTOCK/From_EREP/202411/450d07927f_b36fded7b8.pdf), bought 13.5 million SPMA shares from 2 SPMA directors, [Edward Sopanan](https://www.idx.co.id/StaticData/NewsAndAnnouncement/ANNOUNCEMENTSTOCK/From_EREP/202411/bab594b64b_77186c15c7.pdf) and [Joseph Sulaiman](https://www.idx.co.id/StaticData/NewsAndAnnouncement/ANNOUNCEMENTSTOCK/From_EREP/202411/a779c0be8d_b9c31a6fe7.pdf), at a price of 304 rupiah per share on November 13, 2024. The total transaction value reached ~4.1 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Welly's direct and indirect ownership in SPMA increased from 80.95% to 81.38%, while Edward Sopanan's and Edward Sulaiman's ownership decreased from 0.25% and 0.43% to 0.04% and 0.21% respectively.

tickerNews.title: MBMA Provides Loan Facility Up To US$200 Million To Subsidiary MTI
tickerNews.content: $MBMA: Merdeka Battery Materials [announced](https://www.idx.co.id/StaticData/NewsAndAnnouncement/ANNOUNCEMENTSTOCK/From_EREP/202411/409b283412_60da2a6eda.pdf) the provision of a loan facility of up to 200 million US dollars to its subsidiary, PT Merdeka Tsingshan Indonesia (MTI). The funds will be used by MTI for general corporate purposes.

tickerNews.title: PNGO to Distribute 2024 Interim Dividend of IDR 40 per Share
tickerNews.content: $PNGO: Pinago Utama will [distribute](https://www.idx.co.id/StaticData/NewsAndAnnouncement/ANNOUNCEMENTSTOCK/From_EREP/202411/03fa0f087f_b3aa63bcf0.pdf) interim dividends for the 2024 fiscal year amounting to 31.3 billion rupiah or 40 rupiah per share. Referring to PNGO's stock price at the closing of Tuesday's trading (19/11) at 1,745 rupiah per share, the indicative dividend yield is 2.3%.

tickerNews.title: BFIN Clarifies 9M24 Employee Reduction Due to 'Organization Effectiveness' for Right-Sizing, Disputing 'Layoffs' Term
tickerNews.content: $BFIN: BFI Finance Indonesia in a [clarification to the IDX](https://www.idx.co.id/StaticData/NewsAndAnnouncement/ANNOUNCEMENTSTOCK/From_EREP/202411/3b6aaa6120_33206b3956.pdf) stated that the news of employee reduction of more than 1,000 people during 9M24 was due to an 'organization effectiveness' process to achieve 'right-sizing'. BFIN also stated that the use of the word 'employee cuts' in the news by [CNBC Indonesia](https://www.cnbcindonesia.com/market/20241113144004-17-587912/bfi-finance--bfin--pangkas-1167-karyawan-dalam-6-bulan) on November 14, 2024, was inaccurate because the company considers the number of employees listed in the 3Q24 financial statements to be 'normal' and the same as in 2022. BFIN asserted that the employee reduction occurring during 9M24 did not cause a decrease in the quality of service to consumers.
